properties.name: format
properties.summary: The format of the barcode. Reported with a value of one of the Modules.Barcode.FORMAT_* constant if matching a known format. Otehrwise, may report a string value.

properties.name: result
properties.summary: The raw contents of the barcode

properties.name: code
properties.summary:
The activity result code from the scanning activity. Use the result constants defined in the Titanium.Android namespace

RESULT_CANCELED, RESULT_FIRST_USER, or RESULT_OK

properties.name: contentType
properties.summary: The type of barcode content. Use the constants defined in this module to determine which.

properties.name: data
properties.summary: The parsed fields associated with the contentType.

properties.name: bytes
properties.summary: The raw byte array contents of the barcode, when available

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: The error message

properties.name: code
properties.summary:
The activity result code from the scanning activity. Use the result constants defined in the Titanium.Android namespace

RESULT_CANCELED, RESULT_FIRST_USER, or RESULT_OK

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

events.name: cancel
events.summary: Sent when the scanning process is canceled.

properties.name: message
properties.summary: The error message

properties.name: code
properties.summary:
The activity result code from the scanning activity. Use the result constants defined in the Titanium.Android namespace

RESULT_CANCELED, RESULT_FIRST_USER, or RESULT_OK

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: cancel
methods.summary: Cancels and closes the currently open capture window.

methods.name: canShow
methods.summary: Whether the barcode scanner camera is allowed.

methods.name: capture
methods.summary: Brings up the camera and begins the capture sequence for processing a barcode.

properties.name: allowInstructions
properties.summary: Whether or not to display helpful instructions or a changelog when the app is updated.

properties.name: allowMenu
properties.summary: Whether or not to allow the built-in ZXing menu to display.

properties.name: allowRotation
properties.summary:
Value that indicates if the barcode capture should analyze captured images in either portrait or landscape device orientation. (Warning: Analyzing both the captured image and the rotated version(s) of the image will increase the processing time of the capture.)

  • true: Captured images will be analyzed in both portrait and landscape orientation.
  • false [default]: Captured images will be analyzed using only the current device orientation.

properties.name: displayedMessage
properties.summary: Controls the message that is displayed to the end user when they are capturing a barcode.

properties.name: useFrontCamera
properties.summary: Controls whether or not the front camera on the device will be used to capture barcodes. On Android, this requires API level 9 (Android OS 2.3) or higher. If no front camera is available, this will gracefully fall back to utilize whatever camera is available.

properties.name: useLED
properties.summary: Whether or not to use the LED when scanning barcodes (also known as the flashlight, torch, or some derivation thereof).
